root: ^I'm about to get ready for my shift at work when I find out our shower is broken and I need to shower still!
^Take a "deodorant shower" and go into work.
^Jump in the pool and try to bathe in there.

res1: ^I get to work early but no one wants to work near me because I smell. But I get a lot of work done.

^No one wants to work anywhere near me because I stink and they're all making fun of me. Oh, I am so embarrassed and depressed now. But I got to work early since I skipped a shower and since no one worked anywhere near me I ended up being very productive at work. If that makes it worth it... not sure it does.
res2: ^I call out sick, stay home and watch movies all day.

^I wasn't about to go into work stinking to High Heavens. I call out sick and just stay home and watch movies all day. It was actually really nice to just have a day off, but I probably ate too much junk food in the process.
res3: ^The deodorant masks the fact I didn't shower pretty well but I am paranoid all shift someone will start to smell me.

^No one seemed to notice I didn't shower and the deodorant does the trick. But all shift I'm so nervous, I keep going to the bathroom to use the sink and try to clean myself little by little. I end up being so unproductive at work, I hardly get any work done at all. I also leave work early before I start stinking too much.
res4: ^The pool definitely masks the fact I didn't shower and the chlorine gives me a cool little hairdo.

^The pool did the trick. Who knew?! And in addition to masking the fact that I didn't shower, the chlorine from the pool did something cool to my hair and everyone is asking about my new look and if I got a haircut and being so complimenting. Maybe I shower in the pool before every shift now!
